verses.verse: "I loathe <S%H6962><s%> my own life; <S%H9132><s%> I will give <S%H5800><s%> full <S%H5800><s%> <S%H5921><s%> vent <S%H5800><s%> to my complaint; <S%H7879><s%> I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>
"I will say <S%H559><s%> to God, <S%H433><s%> 'Do not condemn <S%H7561><s%> me; Let me know <S%H3045><s%> why <S%H5921><s%> <S%H4100><s%> Thou dost contend <S%H7378><s%> with me.

'Is it right <S%H2896><s%> for Thee indeed <S%H3588><s%> to oppress, <S%H6231><s%> To reject <S%H3988><s%> the labor <S%H3018><s%> of Thy hands, <S%H3709><s%> And to look <S%H3313><s%> favorably <S%H3313><s%> on the schemes <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>?
'Hast Thou eyes <S%H5869><s%> of flesh <S%H1320><s%>? Or <S%H518><s%> dost Thou see <S%H7200><s%> as a man <S%H582><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%>?
'Are Thy days <S%H3117><s%> as the days <S%H3117><s%> of a mortal, <S%H582><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> Thy years <S%H8141><s%> as man's years, <S%H3117><s%>
That Thou shouldst seek <S%H1245><s%> for my guilt, <S%H5771><s%> And search <S%H1875><s%> after my sin <S%H9128><s%>?

'According <S%H5921><s%> to Thy knowledge <S%H1847><s%> I am indeed <S%H3588><s%> not guilty; <S%H7561><s%> Yet there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> deliverance <S%H5337><s%> from Thy hand. <S%H3027><s%>
'Thy hands <S%H3027><s%> fashioned <S%H9426><s%> and made <S%H6213><s%> me altogether, <S%H3162><s%> <S%H5439><s%> And wouldst Thou destroy <S%H1104><s%> me?
'Remember <S%H2142><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> that Thou hast made <S%H6213><s%> me as clay; <S%H2563><s%> And wouldst Thou turn <S%H7725><s%> me into dust <S%H6083><s%> again <S%H7725><s%>?
'Didst Thou not pour <S%H5413><s%> me out like milk, <S%H2461><s%> And curdle <S%H7087><s%> me like cheese; <S%H1385><s%>
Clothe <S%H3847><s%> me with skin <S%H5785><s%> and flesh, <S%H1320><s%> And knit <S%H9360><s%> me together <S%H9360><s%> with bones <S%H6106><s%> and sinews <S%H1517><s%>?
'Thou hast granted <S%H6213><s%> me life <S%H9132><s%> and lovingkindness; <S%H2617><s%> And Thy care <S%H6486><s%> has preserved <S%H8104><s%> my spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
'Yet these <S%H428><s%> things <S%H428><s%> Thou hast concealed <S%H6845><s%> in Thy heart; <S%H3824><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that this <S%H384><s%> is within <S%H5973><s%> Thee:
If <S%H518><s%> I sin, <S%H2398><s%> then Thou wouldst take <S%H8104><s%> note <S%H8104><s%> of me, And wouldst not acquit <S%H5352><s%> me of my guilt. <S%H5771><s%>

'If <S%H518><s%> I am wicked, <S%H7561><s%> woe <S%H480><s%> to me! And if I am righteous, <S%H6663><s%> I dare not lift <S%H5375><s%> up my head. <S%H7218><s%> [I am] sated <S%H7649><s%> with disgrace <S%H7036><s%> and conscious <S%H7202><s%> of my misery. <S%H6040><s%>

'And should [my head] be lifted <S%H1342><s%> up, Thou wouldst hunt <S%H6679><s%> me like a lion; <S%H7826><s%> And again <S%H7725><s%> Thou wouldst show <S%H6381><s%> Thy power <S%H6381><s%> against me.

'Thou dost renew <S%H2318><s%> Thy witnesses <S%H5707><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> me, And increase <S%H7235><s%> Thine anger <S%H9213><s%> toward <S%H5973><s%> me, Hardship <S%H2487><s%> after hardship <S%H6635><s%> is with me.
'Why <S%H4100><s%> then hast Thou brought <S%H3318><s%> me out of the womb <S%H7358><s%>? Would that I had died <S%H1478><s%> and no <S%H3808><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> had seen <S%H7200><s%> me!
'I should have been <S%H1961><s%> as though <S%H9201><s%> I had not been, <S%H1961><s%> Carried <S%H2986><s%> from womb <S%H990><s%> to tomb. <S%H6913><s%>'
"Would He not let <S%H2308><s%> my few <S%H4592><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> alone <S%H2308><s%>? Withdraw <S%H7896><s%> from me that I may have <S%H1082><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> cheer <S%H1082><s%>
Before <S%H2962><s%> I go <S%H1980><s%> – and I shall not return <S%H7725><s%> – To the land <S%H776><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> and deep <S%H6757><s%> shadow; <S%H6757><s%>

The land <S%H776><s%> of utter <S%H5890><s%> gloom <S%H5890><s%> as darkness <S%H652><s%> [itself,] Of deep <S%H6757><s%> shadow <S%H6757><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> order, <S%H5468><s%> And which shines <S%H3313><s%> as the darkness. <S%H652><s%>"
